name: Index ekonomické svobody
description: Index of Economic Freedom of the World by Fraser Institute is the world's premier measurement of economic freedom, ranking countries based on five areas—size of government, legal structure and property rights, access to sound money, freedom to trade internationally, regulation of credit, labour and business.

name: Index velikosti státní správy
description: Index Size of Government by Fraser Institute measures government consumption, transfers and subsidies, government investment, the top marginal tax rate, and state ownership of assets. An increase in those components reduces economic freedom because it crowds out individual choice.

abbreviation: Index právního systému a respektování vlastnických práv
name: Index právního systému a respektování vlastnických práv
description: Index Legal System and Property Rights by Fraser Institute gauges the level of protection of people and their property rights through components of judicial independence, impartial courts, and the legal enforcement of contracts, among others.

name: Index zdravého peněžního systému
description: Index Sound Money by Fraser Institute constitutes the third category. To the extent that a country’s money is not a reliable store of value, it undermines exchange, hinders economic planning, distorts prices, and, through inflation, serves as a tax. The inflation rate and its volatility are among the components measured here.

name: Index svobody mezinárodního obchodu
description: Index Freedom to Trade by Fraser Institute measures tariff rates, nontariff trade barriers, and controls on capital movement, among other indicators.

name: Index regulace
description: Index of Regulation by Fraser Institute regards the regulation of business, labor, and credit. To the extent that government restricts competition in business, voluntary arrangements among employers and employees, and freedom of exchange in credit markets, economic freedom is reduced. Indicators measured include interest rate controls, hiring and firing regulations, and licensing restrictions, among others.
